## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm still learning about Verus and currencies. Can anyone create a currency with a specific name, without needing an ID of the same name?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not correct. To create a currency of a specific name, you need an ID of the same name, and the controller of that ID is the only one who can create a currency of that name, and they can only do so once. You can't just create a currency with any name without having the corresponding ID. Does that make sense?

**User:**
Okay, got it. Another question I had was, is it possible to create a currency without preallocating funds to it?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not possible. When defining a currency, you need to fund the identity of the currency with at least 10 VRSCTEST before sending the transaction to initiate a currency launch. Additionally, there needs to be a certain amount of VRSCTEST preconverted to the new currency in order to launch it. So, you can't just create a currency out of thin air without putting in the necessary funds.

**User:**
One more question. Can I create new tokens for a currency after it has launched without a centralized issuance option?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not currently possible. After a currency has launched, the only way to create new tokens is with a centralized issuance option. So, if you want to create more tokens for your currency, you'll need to have a centralized issuance option in place.
Can anyone create a currency with a specific name, without needing an ID of the same name?

No, that's not correct. To create a currency of a specific name, you need an ID of the same name, and the controller of that ID is the only one who can create a currency of that name, and they can only do so once.

To create a currency of a specific name, you need an ID of the same name. The controller of this ID is the only one who can create a currency of that name, and they can only do so once.
So, let's hypothetically assume I have 3 IDs, one named gold@, one named mycoin@, and one named mike@. I would like to have one currency, gold@,
that I somehow launch in a way that maps it in a way that can be widely trusted to a specific, auditable store of gold.
I also would like to launch a token called mycoin@, which is something like a Kickstarter, where a business, "my", offers to attribute the coins some utility or product value if the purchase exceeds a certain level.
First, I could define the currency "gold" as follows:
 ```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"gold","options":32,"currencies":["vrsctest"],"conversions":[0.01],"minpreconversion":[1000],"preallocations":[{"mike@":50000000.00000000}]}'
```
of course, since this is a test currency, I send myself some to start. The identity of the currency must be funded with at least 10 VRSCTEST before sending the transaction returned from this command to
initiate a currency launch that will start at 50 blocks from when it was made (default), and that must have 1000 VRSCTEST preconverted at 0.01 VRSCTEST per GOLD in order to launch.
all of this happens as part of the mining process, since mining the blocks that launch a currency earn the 0.025% conversion fees of participation
in the launch, converting VRSCTEST to GOLD. I could send the following command before the block where GOLD token launches.
After it launches, the only way at present to create new tokens is with a centralized issuance option. To convert VRSCTEST to GOLD, you could issue the command:
 ```
./verus -chain=VRSCTE
